segment.source: Windows 10 DISM Command-Line Options
segment.target: Windows 10 DISM Command-Line Options

segment.source: Windows 10 DISM Command-Line Options
segment.target: Windows 10 DISM Command-Line Options

segment.source: Windows 10 DISM Command-Line Options
segment.target: Windows 10 DISM Command-Line Options

segment.source: Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM.exe) mounts a Windows image (.wim) file or virtual hard disk (.vhd or .vhdx) for servicing.
segment.target: Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM.exe) mounts a Windows image (.wim) file or virtual hard disk (.vhd or .vhdx) for servicing.

segment.source: You can also use DISM to install, uninstall, configure, and update the features and packages in offline Windows images and offline Windows Preinstallation Environment (WinPE) images.
segment.target: You can also use DISM to install, uninstall, configure, and update the features and packages in offline Windows images and offline Windows Preinstallation Environment (WinPE) images.

segment.source: For more information about common DISM scenarios, see What is DISM?.
segment.target: For more information about common DISM scenarios, see What is DISM?.

segment.source: In addition to the command-line tool, DISM is available by using PowerShell.
segment.target: In addition to the command-line tool, DISM is available by using PowerShell.

segment.source: For more information, see Deployment Imaging Servicing Management (DISM) Cmdlets in Windows PowerShell.
segment.target: For more information, see Deployment Imaging Servicing Management (DISM) Cmdlets in Windows PowerShell.

segment.source: DISM replaces tools including PEImg, Intlcfg, Package Manager, and ImageX.
segment.target: DISM replaces tools including PEImg, Intlcfg, Package Manager, and ImageX.

segment.source: In This Section
segment.target: In This Section

segment.source: DISM Image Management Command-Line Options
segment.target: DISM Image Management Command-Line Options

segment.target: Image management commands such as capturing, applying, and mounting a Windows image.

segment.target: Servicing commands that can be used to check the applicability of Windows Installer application patches (.msp files) and to query your offline image for information about installed MSI applications and application patches (.msp files).

segment.target: Servicing commands for importing, exporting, removing, and enumerating the settings that specify which application opens a file based on file extension or protocol
